sen.j: 大宮御所（おおみやごしょ）とは、大正天皇崩御によって皇太后となった貞明皇后のために赤坂離宮の敷地内（現在の赤坂御用地）に建設された御殿のこと。
sen.e: Omiya Gosho was a residence built for Empress Teimei who became an empress dowager when Emperor Taisho had passed away on the premise of Akasaka Rikyu (The State Guest House) (present-day Akasaka Imperial property).

sen.j: 1929年12月10日に竣工され、翌年6月1日に「大宮御所」が正式名称として定められて、5日後に貞明皇后が移られた。
sen.e: The residence was completed on December 10, 1929, "Omiya Gosho" was given as an official name on June 1 of the following year, and Empress Teimei moved in five days later.

sen.j: 「広芝」と称された敷地面積6500坪余り、建物の総坪数は2667坪であった。
sen.e: The total acreage in the building was 8,801 sq. m. and the ground-floor area known as "Hiroshiba" was 21,450 sq. m.
The total area of the building was approximately 8,801 square meters and the area of the premise known as "Hiroshiba" was approximately 21,450 square meters.

sen.e: The total area of the building was approximately 8,801 square meters and the area of the premise known as "Hiroshiba" was approximately 21,450 square meters.

sen.j: その後、1945年5月25日の空襲によって焼失し、翌年12月13日に新しい宮殿が再建されて6日後に貞明皇后が移られた。
sen.e: Later, it was burnt down by the air raid on May 25, 1945; a new residence was rebuilt on December 13 of the following year and Empress Teimei moved in six days later.
Later, it was burnt down by the air raid on May 25, 1945 and a new residence was rebuilt on December 13 of the following year, where Empress Teimei moved six days later.
sen.cmt: セミコロンの使用をやめ一文にしました。
sen.e: Later, it was burnt down by the air raid on May 25, 1945 and a new residence was rebuilt on December 13 of the following year, where Empress Teimei moved six days later.

sen.j: 貞明皇后崩御の翌年である1952年1月に廃止された。
sen.e: It was abolished in January, 1952, the year after Empress Teimei had died.

sen.j: その後、1960年に跡地に東宮御所が建設されて皇太子明仁親王が入った。
sen.e: Later, Togu Gosho (Crown Prince's Palace) was constructed on the vacant lot in 1960 and Crown Prince Akihito moved in.

sen.j: 昭和天皇崩御後に即位した今上天皇（明仁親王）はここをそのまま天皇の御所として用い皇居の赤坂御所となる。
sen.e: After the death of Emperor Showa, the present Emperor (Imperial Prince Akihito) stayed in the Togu Gosho and used it for the Empero's imperial palace; therefore, the palace came to be known as the Akasaka Imperial Palace.

sen.j: 皇太后となった香淳皇后は昭和天皇の吹上御所をそのまま吹上大宮御所として用いたため、新たな大宮御所の建設は行われなかった。
sen.e: Empress Kojun who became an empress dowager stayed in the Emperor Showa's Fukiage Gosho (the old imperial palace of Fukiage) and used it as the Fukiage Omiya Palace; therefore, there was no need to construct a new Omiya Gosho.

sen.j: 後に今上天皇は吹上御苑内に建設された現在の新吹上御所に移られ、代わりに皇太子徳仁親王が赤坂の御所に入られて再び東宮御所となっている。
sen.e: Later, the present Emperor moved in the present-day new Fukiage Gosho which was constructed on the premise of the Fukiage Imperial Gardens and Crown Prince Naruhito moved in the Akasaka Imperial Palace in his place; as a result, the Akasaka Imperial Palace came to be known as Togu Gosho again.
